intro: Pentace curtisii, commonly known as the Curtis's pentace, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or coastal habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
